title: Mets Postseason Run Raising Fortunes of Citi Field Bondholders - Bloomberg Business
text:
Share on Facebook Share on Twitter Share on WhatsApp Share on LinkedIn Share on Reddit Share on Google+ E-mail Share on Twitter Share on WhatsApp The New York Mets are one win away from playing in their first World Series in 15 years, and Citi Field bondholders are cheering along with the team’s fans.
Riding on this season’s playoff run, the team projects total 2016 attendance will rise by 500,000 to 3.1 million, generating an additional $25 million in revenue, according to a person familiar with the estimate. That’s on top of a 20 percent attendance increase this year.
That’s good news for fans who suffered as the team cut payroll after the the majority owners of the club, led by Fred Wilpon, lost millions investing with Ponzi scheme swindler Bernie Madoff. It’s also good news for holders of almost $700 million Citi Field bonds, who’ve seen the ball park’s attendance and revenue fall below projections.
